snippet: Palestinian leaders have plans to join the International Criminal Court in The Hague, which experts say could prosecute Israel for settlement building in territories that Palestinians claim.
abstract: Palestinian leadership, with collapse of American-brokered Middle East negotiations, is focusing on its diplomatic and legal struggle for international recognition of Palestine as state under occupation and for Israel to be held accountable as the occupier; has plans to join International Criminal Court in The Hague.
lead_paragraph: Palestinian leaders have plans to join the International Criminal Court in The Hague, which experts say could prosecute Israel for settlement building in territories that Palestinians claim.

headline.main: After Failed Peace Talks, Pushing to Label Israel as Occupier of Palestine
headline.print_headline: After Failed Peace Talks, Pushing to Label Israel as Occupier of Palestine
